item.title: Report E-2025040213
item.description:
Report E-2025040213

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-10
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L TRANSFER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 10, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1760 was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025040660
item.description:
Report X-2025040660

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-10
  • City: SAUK VILLAGE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ARCBEST INTERNATIONAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Chris Zavala, 034 Operations Manager, contacted Safety regarding a UN3265 spill on the pallet located on the dock. Chris Zavala advised Brandon Nelson unloaded the freight and as was moving the freight down the dock. Chris Zavala stated Edgar Terrazas was also moving freight down the dock when Edgar Terrazas freight punctured the pallet Brandon Nelson was moving. Chris Zavala advised he received conflicting statements from both employees of who damaged the freight. Safety advised Chris Zavala CURA will be contacted for remediation. Chris Zavala requested straight time remediation. Chris Zavala advised the spill is contained and the jug is turned over on it's side to stop the spill. Ariana Lopez with CURA was contacted for remediation on straight time.

  • Description: On April 9, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Graymar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents, hand tools, and cleaning agents to remediate the impacted locations. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • City: DALLAS

  • Description: On April 9, 2025, two (2) 22-liter jugs of Rhino Brite were damaged in transit and released approximately 1.5-gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carrier retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the site. ES&H personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged jugs of product were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: Chris Lawrence, Operations Supervisor, called Safety to report a smell coming from a 5-gallon tank of UN3336, Mercaptan mixture, liquid, flammable, n.o.s, 3, PGll, sitting on the dock in bay 11. Chris stated that the tank did not appear to be damaged in any way, but there was a noticeable smell comi ng from it. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Lander Allgood, who advised that to be safe, he would send a team out to check the tank. Safety informed Chris that CURA had been called to assist with the tank.

item.description:
Report X-2025040884

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT HAD TWO DIFFERENT TRACKING LABELS APPLIED WITH TWO DIFFERENT ACCOUNT NUMBERS AND CONSIGNEES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE NEON MULTI-PURPOSE REFILLABLE LIGHTERS CONTAINING BUTANE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF IN TEXAS AND IS NOW SUSPECTED OF BEING FRAUDULENTLY TENDERED. ONE TRACKING NUMBER IS 1Z855WX20174034585. THERMAL LABEL SHIPPER IS 1 SK, 250 HARWIN DR STE C, OUSTON, OUSTON TX 77036. SHIP TO IS PAULA M BALDERSON, 2765789550, 2452 MILL CREEK RD, COUNCIL ID 83612-5222. THE OWNER OF ACCOUNT 855WX2 IS ADONIS PRECISION, INC, 25 REGENCY OAKS BLVD, ROCHESTER NY 14624-5902. THE ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER ON THE PACKAGE IS 1Z6X2W030185093338. THERMAL LABEL SHIPPER IS UMZEE GROUP, 019 OWL ECHO CT, OUSTON TX 77082. SHIP TO IS DORIE TCHOURUMOFF, 3770983332, 122 SQUIRREL TREE LN, MOUNT LAUREL NJ 08054-2112. THE OWNER OF THIS ACCOUNT IS 6X2W03 IS KRISTINA CLARK, 1131 JACKSON AVE, TUSCALOOSA AL 35401.

  • Description: DURING THE X-RAY PROCESS AT THE UPS FACILITY IN HONG KONG, ONE PACKAGE FROM THE UNITED KINGDOM WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE LITHIUM-ION BATTERY POWER BANK. THE INVOICE DESCRIPTION IS REPLACEMENT WALL CHARGER. THE POWER BANK IS A MAGSAFE IPHONE BATTERY PACK. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE UNITED KINGDOM USING UPS ACCOUNT B68767, NORSK EUROPEAN WHOLESALE LTD, 2 WILLOW ROAD, COLNBROOK SL3 0BS UNITED KINGDOM. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT.

item.title: Report E-2025040194
item.description:
Report E-2025040194

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 4th, 2025, while loading and unloading a shipment of liquid drums at Veolia's 10-day in-transit facility, a Veolia employee picked up a drum of petroleum distillates using the drum gripper to weigh it. During this process, a co-worker noticed a small pinhole leak in the drum. The employees promptly covered the hole with a spill pad and tape to stop the leak, then cleaned up the spilled liquid on the floor using spill dry. The leaking drum was overpacked into a 951H2 container for continued transportation.

item.description:
Report X-2025040657

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/3/2025 at approximately 1330 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification of undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 2 fiberboard boxes, each contained multiple bottles of perfume. AWB# 772715499316 had 22 bottles of perfume and AWB 772787929150 had 19 bottles of perfume. Customs intercepted the shipment for further investigation, which confirmed the presence of the perfume. Neither shipment was prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it did not display the required markings, labeling, packaging, or paperwork. Customs has requested that the shipments be destroyed.

  • Description: On 4/3/2025 at approximately 1230 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification of undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 50 bottles: 5@70ml, 3@75ml, 32@100ml, 3@125ml, 4@120ml, & 3@80ml. Customs intercepted the shipment for further investigation, which confirmed suspicions of undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment was refused at entry and Customs has requested disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/26/2025 at approximately 1400 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. This report covers 4 different shipments from the same shipper. Each package contains several bottles of perfume and cologne. The shipments were flagged by Customs under the suspicion of potentially containing undeclared dangerous goods. Further investigation confirmed these suspicions. The packages were not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as they did not display the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. All shipments are being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report E-2025040223
item.description:
Report E-2025040223

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1730 ET, XPO-XLA notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 4-5oz of Clethodim 2e released from a plastic tote due to improper loading (strap rubbed on the tote causing a release). The release impacted the concrete dock and inside trailer#317-8081. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4 to 5 ounces of UN1993 Clethodim 2e product released from the plastic tote due to a strap rubbing on the corner. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into (2) 200-gallon poly/UV totes due to the excess product. The old tote was triple rinsed and is now considered RCRA empty. Contractors placed impacted PPE in (1) 55-gallon metal drum and impacted oil dry in another (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: B-Ann Driver was dispatched for a power unit only load for Southwest Logistics/ OFS Inc. B-Ann Driver picked up trailer #463 in OKC and picked up a load of Ferric Chloride in Russelville Arkansas and Delivered to Topeka, KS. The driver noticed a tire separating on the trailer, he contacted Southwest Logistics/OFS Inc dispatch for direction on where to go for repairs. Southwest Logistics dispatcher sent B-Ann Driver to Loves truck stop El Dorado KS. Upon arrival B-Ann Driver noticed a leak on the trailer. He contacted Southwest Logistics Dispatcher, who contacted Don Cox. OFS INC/ Southwest Logistics Safety Manager, Don Cox then contacted Boomer Enviriomental to contain and Clean up spill

item.title: Report E-2025040116
item.description:
Report E-2025040116

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-10
  • City: EAST DEERFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Berkshire and Eastern Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: MULX 701436 arrived on MOED-10 on R2, loaded car of propane was found to be leaking B end liquid line. At approximately 2300 hrs, 3/10/2025, Hepaco received a call from Rita Mager, Berkshire & Eastern RR, requesting a response to leaking tank car at the Deerfield Yard. Hepaco arrived on site at 0100 hrs, 3/11/2025, and held safety briefing. At 0115 hrs, track protection was received and Hepaco mounted car. It was found that the B end liquid valve was not secured and the liquid valve secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Hepaco made corrections in form of securing both the liquid valve and secondary closure. 0230 hrs, Hepaco offsite. There was no waste generated from this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025040167
item.description:
Report E-2025040167

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND TRAINING SOLUTIONS, INCORPORATED
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured pail containing hazardous product, Vapor Retarder Primer VC. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 3-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 5 x 5 area as a result of a forklift puncture. The contractor applied oil dry to the release and overpacked the damaged leaking drum. The consignee accepted the rest of the undamaged/un-impacted freight. One 55-gallon DF containing the overpacked leaking pail was generated for waste disposal. One 55-gallon DF containing impacted oil dry and pallet pieces was generated for waste disposal. One 55-gallon DM containing impacted oil dry and pallet pieces was generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the incident. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.description:
Report E-2025040112

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-06
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area and 2ft-by-2ft area of asphalt and a 10ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor. They estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released most likely due to a forklift puncturing one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Clean Harbors personnel inspected all 24 drums on the trailer and found only one (1) drum was affected. The damaged 55-gallon metal drum was contained in one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. Contractor personnel deployed granular absorbents to the affected areas and containerized them into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite and will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025041099
item.description:
Report X-2025041099

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-05
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WENT TO CALL FOR A LEAKER IN PACKAGE CAR. BROUGHT BAG WITH LEAKING BOX BACK WITH NOXIOUS SMELLING PACKAGE WITH NO MARKINGS IN SPILL TUB AND PLACED ON SHELF. UPON SMELLING THE NOXIOUS SMELL, INVESTIGATED THE PACKAGE. MOVED PACKAGE TO HOOD TO HELP REDUCE NOXIOUS SMELL. PACKAGE WAS UNOPENED AND CONTENTS NOT IDENTIFIED ON THE SERVICE CROSS. DONNED PPE PER UNKNOWN BOX RESPONSE SHEET INCLUDING SILVER SHIELD LIVERS AND OPENED PACKAGE. UPON OPENING DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS UNDECLARED HAZMAT UN1133 ADHESIVE WITH FLAMMABLE LIQUID.

item.title: Report E-2025040107
item.description:
Report E-2025040107

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 14500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured leaking poly tote containing hazardous product, Barquat MB-50. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 140-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor, the concrete beneath the trailer, the asphalt parking lot, and the soil. The trailer floor was impacted in a 20 x 8.5 area and the concrete beneath the trailer, asphalt, and soil were impacted in a 100 x 75 area. The contractor neutralized the release and applied oil dry. A vac truck extracted approximately 2,700-gallons of impacted rainwater and containerized it into one vac box. Three 55-gallon DFs containing the cut-up tote, impacted oil dry, and impacted PPE were also generated. ERTS will coordinate disposal of the vac box. XPO will manage the drum waste created from the response. No storm-drains or waterways were involved in this incident.

  • Description: On April 4, 2025, two (2) 3-liter pails of paint were crushed and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to cardboard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the site. The crew placed the damaged pails in one (1) 5-gallon pail. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the spent material and all impacted materials in one (1) additional 5-gallon pail.

  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE WEST PRIMKARY AT BAY 84. USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE LEAKING PACKAGES AND OTHER MATERIAL. PACKAGES AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF HAZMAT, CONTENTS WAS SOILED AND THEREFORE SOLIDIFIED. THE MATERIAL WAS BAGGED, MEASURED, WEIGHED AND INFORMATION WAS ENTERED INTO THE DMP/ETT SYSTEM.

  • Description: On April 3, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of adhesive was crushed and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer. GES also cut up the impacted pallet. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum of product was placed in one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED PALED AND SENT TO THE SOUTH SORT ISLE. THERE THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING. THE SORTER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED THE SUPERVISOR.THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATOR RESPONDER.THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONCE SHEET PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILLED TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECK LIST, THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING IT WAS THERE IT WAS DISCOVERED TO BE AN UNDECLEARED HAZMAT.

  • Description: During loading process, EQIS driver discovers drum on pallet with regulated waste material leaking from side, and that generator staff had installed locking ring upside down, and with inadequate ring gasket. Approximate loss of product from packaging approx. .5 to 1 gallon. Material cleaned up by staff, cleaning trailer floor and exterior of package. Our driver re-installed the ring closure appropriately and monitored this package to point of delivery with no further loss of product. Minimal product loss was contained within small area of trailer floor and cleaned up by our staff with no release outside of trailer.

  • Description: On April 2, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1170 was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the dock. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed in one (1) 85-gallon overpack.

  • City: MARIETTA

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 2, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was damaged and released approximately thirty-five (35) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted areas. All impacted materials were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum of product was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon overpack.

While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that one of the jerrycans was punctured on the bottom by a nail from the wooden skid. The damaged jerrycan was placed in to a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: Freight was loaded on beams in the trailer and fell off the beams in transit due to lack of blocking and bracing. The operations assistant advised that the freight was billed as two pallets of books, but advised that the freight appears to be Fuji Film plate developer replenisher in jugs in boxes showing corrosive 8. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation.~~Called CURA and spoke with Lizzie who advised a crew would be sent out and will attempt to clarify details. ~~Cura advised the product to be UN1814, Potassium hydroxide, solution, 8, PG II.

item.title: Report E-2025040037
item.description:
Report E-2025040037

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-01
  • City: ALBANY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 55-gallon metal drum containing hazardous product, Leaded Race Fuel. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 55-gallons released onto the entire wooden trailer floor, the asphalt beneath the trailer in a 60x10 area, and a drain (catch basin) as a result of a forklift puncture. The contractor cleaned up the release using a vac truck and oil dry. One 85-gallon DF containing the empty damaged drum was generated for waste disposal along with three 55-gallon DMs containing impacted absorbents, and 2,800-gallons of impacted water inside of the vac truck. XPO will manage the waste drums created from the response and ERTS will coordinate disposal of the vac truck liquids at a local third-party disposal site. No waterways or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025040012
item.description:
Report E-2025040012

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-31
  • City: WHITMORE LAKE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 275-gallon tote containing hazardous product, Scale Trol-G. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-gallon release onto the top of the tote and onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4 x 4 area as a result of improper packaging a faulty cap on the tote. The contractor replaced the cap on the tote and performed a slosh test. The tote passed and was shipped on to the consignee. The release was cleaned up with Kolor Safe neutralizer and absorbent rags. One 30-gallon DF of waste was generated containing the neutralized, impacted rags. XPO will manage all waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025040003
item.description:
Report E-2025040003

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-31
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/31/2025, at 10:22 hours, personnel in the CSXT Parsons Yard discovered tank car NATX 301995, residue: last contained Petroleum Distillates, N.O.S., leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Berryman Chemical, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2025 0331 000056). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found product leaving from the bottom outlet valve. Contractor personnel determined the release was the result of a faulty bottom outlet valve and a secondary closure that was less than tool tight. The car was fully empties of its contents and the secondary closure cap secured. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Sarah Lombardo (832-571-2514). The car was held at location pending further repair by a certified MRU or receipt of a OTMA from FRA.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 31, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of sodium nitrate had a loose lid and released approximately eight (8) ounces of product to the top of the tote. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. Crews attempted to removed the product from the tote, but were unsuccessful and recommended a tote transfer. Per R+L Safety's request, no transfer will be made until approval is received from the shipper (Univar Solutions). Crews labeled the tote with a "Do Not Ship" label, and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2025040046
item.description:
Report E-2025040046

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-27
  • City: FLINT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors personnel arrived onsite and observed an estimated two (2) cups of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic jug. The material released impacted multiple areas in the trailer. A neutralizer was deployed while cleaning the trailer. Clean Harbors personnel began transferring the product in the remaining containers into IBC plastic totes. A total of three totes were used to transfer the material. All the empty containers from the transferred product were placed into eight poly-lined cubic yard boxes. Four (4) 55-gallon poly drums and two (2) 30-gallon poly drums of impacted absorbents and PPE were also generated from the spill. The generated waste was staged onsite and will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal. The ESTES terminal supervisor approved all work before Clean Harbors departed

item.title: Report E-2025030469
item.description:
Report E-2025030469

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-26
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/26/2025, at 12:57 hours, FRA Inspector Quinton Grant reported PROX 280006, a loaded tank car containing acetone, was leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the Shipper, Advansix, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025-03-26-00144). Marion Environmental Inc (MEI), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid line leaking between the base of the liquid line valve and tank cars pressure plate. MEI personnel were able to tighten the liquid line valve mounting bolts and stop the release. Contractor personnel verified the car built 6 psi of pressure in the tank car and remained leak free. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Jeffery Matlack (804-530-6285). The tank car was delivered to Whitaker Industries with the approval from FRA Inspector Kevin Cash.

item.description:
Report X-2025040092

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-22
  • City: SAN PABLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 12:17 ON 3/22/2025 RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL, SAYING WAS NEEDED AT DOOR 64 ASAP. RESPONDER WENT OVER TO DOOR 64 WHERE A SUPERVISOR WAS PULLING A PACKAGE DOWN FORM THE GRATING AND PLACING IT ON A PALLET. ANOTHER EXPLAINED THAT WHILE A LOADER WAS PULLING THE PACKAGE OFF THE EXTEND IT STARTED TO SPARK FROM THE INSIDE. WHEN THIS HAPPENED, SHE DROPPED THE PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR, AND IT IMMEDIATELY CAUGHT FIRE ON ONE END. ONE END OF THE BOX WAS OPEN, AND RESPONDER COULD SEE SCORCH MARKS ON THE DEVICE INSIDE AND THE INSIDE FLAPS OF THE PACKAGE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A LITHIUM BATTERY WAS BEING SHIPPED GROUND SERVICE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT 16A732, ENERZ-Z, 3984 EMERALD DOWNS DR, YORBA LINDA CA 92886.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING ON ROUTE BY THE DRIVER WHILE DELIVERING. IT WAS CONTAINED IN A PLASTIC BAG AND BROUGHT BACK TO THE BUILDING. PACKAGE WAS INSPSECTED AND AN SDS CHECKED, WHICH REVEALED THE CONTENTS TO BE REGULATED MATERIAL SHIPPED IN AN AMOUNT QUALIFYING FOR LIMITED QUANTY. HOWEVER, PACKAGING HAS NO HAZMAT MARKS OR LABELS. PACKAGING IS A PLASTIC ENVELOPED AS OPPOSED TO A STURDY BOX REQUIRED FOR LIMITED QUANTITY SHIPMENTS. HAZMAT SUPPORT DESK WAS CALLED TO INITIATE THE UNDECLARED SHIPMENT PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report E-2025030341
item.description:
Report E-2025030341

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/20/25, at 13:24 hours, an FRA inspector in the CSXT Acca Yard discovered UTLX 630359, a loaded tank car of sodium hydroxide solution, had leaked from manway. The car was isolated and the shipper, Associated Asphalt Inc., was notified via CHEMTREC (report# 2025-0320-00129). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found release was caused one of six manway cover bolts being less than tool tight. Contractor personnel tightened the manway cover bolts and decontaminated the exterior of the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- David Taylor (804-704-7242).

item.description:
Report E-2025040127

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-14
  • City: RICHLAND CENTER
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At the end of the offload our driver hooked up an airline that runs from the compressor on the tractor to an air inlet valve that comes off of the discharge valve used for sampling and blowing the lines clean at the end of offloading. He turned on the air compressor and opened the external valve partially and began walking the line but it wasn't get light like it should. he looked back and saw that the end of the airline connected to the compressor on his truck came off the connection and product was backflowing from his product hose into the discharge valve and ultimately through the airline and on to the ground. Estimating 16 ounces hit the ground.

  • City: MARKLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon plastic jug due to a forklift accident that resulted in the jug being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040109
item.description:
Report E-2025040109

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-08
  • City: VALLEJO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that there were seven trooper vehicles, 4 fire trucks, and CEMA personnel onsite assisting with cleanup, too. The released material impacted the trailer floor and the asphalt of the highway. Clean Harbors personnel transferred an estimated two hundred and twenty-five (225) gallons of material to a new tote using an onsite gravity transfer. The damaged and new totes were offloaded from the trailer. The contractor estimated fifty (50) gallons of Ethanol was released from the tote. There were no areas to clean in the trailer because the Ethanol had evaporated. A hazmat driver from Clean Harbors arrived to assist with taking the trailer, both totes, and waste to the West Sacramento ESTES terminal. The empty tote and the tote of product were labeled and staged in the center of the dock near 136 door. The waste generated will remain onsite for the ESTES team to coordinate disposal. It is recommended the asphalt at the site of the release should be pressure washed.

The released product, and oil-dri will be placed into a 65-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum with waste product will be placed into an 85-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2025040088
item.description:
Report E-2025040088

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 21:30 EST on 3/3, XPO-XGR contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 gallons of "1.4 Low VOC Cleaner" from 4x 1-gallon metal pails on the dock floor. The box was punctured by a forklift at XGR. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined the terminal did not have sufficient PPE to clean the spill, citing goggles. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of UN1263 1.4 Low VOC Cleaner product released impacting 2x4 area of the dock floor due to forklift puncture. The crew restacked the pallet and wiped down the other products which had been impacted by the spill. There was (1) 1-gallon bottle found damaged and the other 3 in the punctured box were not damaged. The waste was collected into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025040119
item.description:
Report E-2025040119

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: Labadie
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KIESEL CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 288295
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The driver exited Hwy MM, turning on Hwy T, the front right steer tire side wall ruptured, sending the truck into a 20' ditch. The tractor and trailer rolled on its side, slid across 2 more ditches and then the fifth wheel broke and the tractor continued sliding and came to rest in the final ditch. The 1st compartment of the trailer ruptured and approx 1,475 gallons of diesel fuel was released. The temperature was below freezing, the ditches were frozen and the red dye diesel stayed in the snow and on top of the ice. Kiesel sent a cleanup crew and vacuum trucks to empty the remaining contents of the trailer and vacuum up free liquids. The recovered materials were transported to the Kiesel terminal. Dams were created in the ditches under the oversight of the USEPA and Missouri Department of Natural Resources to prevent spread of contamination. When the snow melted, cleaning of the ditches commenced. All of the dams except for 1 have been removed and the cleanup is in its final stage. Contaminated soils have been excavated and transported to Waste Management Milam Landfill. All response operations performed with approval of USEPA.

item.title: Report E-2025040082
item.description:
Report E-2025040082

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: JETBLUE AIRWAYS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Flight 1316 LAX-JFK diverted to DEN due to having an e-cigarette with a lithium battery loaded in the belly of the aircraft. Two bags were checked in at the kiosk (1 grey duffle and 1 orange bag) and one grey duffle bag was checked in at the gate. Notified the gate agent, that lithium batteries were in his checked bag. Using the Bag Request App, gate agent informed the GO supervisors to get his baggage. He attempted to board the plane with three personal belongings at 00:41. Gate agent informed CUS that he had to check in one bag. The CUS stated that he wanted to reorganize the items in his baggage and that he had tools that included lithium batteries. The bag was taken and placed on the AC once it had been reorganized. The jetbridge was pulled from the AC and the GO crew was waiting to push. CUS told Inflight that there was an e-cigarette in his gate check. The jetbridge was pulled back up to the AC so that the Gate Agent could speak with him. GO was notified to get CUS' gate check bag. The originally requested bag was pulled thus leaving the gate check and 1 other checked bag on the AC. When they arrived at DEN, they discovered an e-cigarette in one bag and a laptop in the other.

item.title: Report E-2025040114
item.description:
Report E-2025040114

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: LEHIGH ACRES
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LEE COUNTY MOSQUITO CONTROL DISTRICT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver thought that the meter had a tenth section, so instead of loading 77 gallons, he reached 189 (thinking this equated to 18.9 gallons). At this point, fuel started to appear and the pump was shut off and containment operations commenced. Because we are required to report within 15 minutes, I estimated that 100 gallons was spilled for the initial report. Our spill response crew absorbed and recovered all spilled fuel with appropriate PPE and appropriately cleaned the airport ramp fueling area. Jet fuel was transferred in order to maintain the air space in the tanker including any recovered fuel which did not reach the ramp ground back into the jet fuel tank of origin (through appropriate filtration). After further calculations, beyond the initial 15 minutes, we believe that between 30 - 50 gallons were spilled before being absorbed and appropriately being disposed of at an approved disposal facility.
